abstract: Patricia Kutteles, mother of Pfc Barry Winchell, who was murdered by fellow officer in 1999 during homophobia-driven attack, dies at age 67; Kutteles fought relentlessly for repeal of American military's 'don't ask, don't tell' policy in memory of her son.

headline.print_headline: Patricia Kutteles, Fighter of ‘Don’t Tell’ Policy, Dies at 67
headline.main: Patricia Kutteles, Driven by Tragedy to End ‘Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell,’ Dies at 67

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Mrs. Kutteles’s relentless efforts helped reverse the policy against gay soldiers serving openly, a decade after her son was beaten to death by a fellow soldier....
lead_paragraph: Mrs. Kutteles’s relentless efforts helped reverse the policy against gay soldiers serving openly, a decade after her son was beaten to death by a fellow soldier.
